news.title: Blackstone's Lumina CloudInfra buys 3.8-acre in Mumbai’s Chandivali for ₹475 crore
news.para: Lumina CloudInfra, backed by Blackstone, has acquired 3.8 acres in Mumbai's Chandivali for ₹475 crore to develop a 60 MW data centre. This project will increase Lumina's Mumbai region capacity to 240 MW, contributing to their total of 600 MW underway across India.

news.title: Zomato Hyperpure leases 2.5 lakh sq ft warehouse in Bhiwandi near Mumbai
news.para: Zomato Hyperpure is expanding its supply chain operations with a new 2.5 lakh sq ft warehouse in Bhiwandi, near Mumbai, under a five-year lease. The lease, commencing in August 2025, involves a monthly rental of Rs 66.21 lakh and aims to bolster Hyperpure's ability to supply fresh ingredients to restaurants and institutional clients in a key consumption hub.

news.title: Suraj Estate Developers launches ₹250 crore project in Mumbai
news.para: Suraj Estate Developer, a Mumbai-based company, has launched Suraj Park View 1. It is a luxury residential project in Dadar with a gross development value of Rs 250 crore. The 29-storey tower has a saleable carpet area of 0.53 lakh sq ft. The project is developed under a redevelopment model. The company's portfolio includes ongoing and upcoming projects.

news.title: Streetlight woes persist as Lucknow civic body gets over 1,000 complaints
news.para: Lucknow residents are facing prolonged issues with faulty or missing streetlights, with over 1,100 complaints pending with the LMC. The worst-affected areas are in Zone 8, especially Fazullaganj and Paper Mill ward. Amid criticism, LMC has reissued a tender worth Rs 10 crore for 16,000 new streetlights in extended areas after controversy over the initial tender process.

news.title: Punjab government orders Mohali development body to acquire land under old policy
news.para: The Punjab government has instructed Greater Mohali Area Development Authority to acquire land using the old policy. This follows farmer protests that led to the withdrawal of a new land pooling policy. Gmada will acquire about 2,600 acres for projects like Aerotropolis and Eco City-3. The aim is to meet development needs and prevent unauthorized colonies.

news.title: Bhubaneswar: 498 acres of land under encroachment, action plan launched
news.para: Chief minister Mohan Charan Majhi revealed that approximately 498 acres of government land in Bhubaneswar have been encroached upon, with Jaydev Vihar topping the list at 148 acres. To address this, a central enforcement monitoring committee has been formed, and the government is filing cases under the Odisha Public Premises Act to remove unauthorised occupants.

news.title: Bombay HC seeks report from SRA CEO as half of ongoing scheme’s flats ‘sold’
news.para: The Bombay High Court has expressed serious concerns regarding the illegal sale of flats allocated under a slum rehabilitation scheme in Sion-Koliwada. The court directed the Slum Rehabilitation Authority (SRA) CEO to investigate the matter, noting that a significant number of allottees had transferred their properties against regulations.

news.title: Telangana HC issues notice to collector over illegal constructions on disputed Bhoodan lands
news.para: The Telangana High Court has issued notices to Rangareddy district collector C Narayana Reddy concerning alleged illegal constructions on disputed Bhoodan lands in Nagaram village. The court raised concerns about the collector's inaction regarding constructions, despite prior orders directing a status quo.

news.title: Odisha RERA issues guidelines for smooth dispute resolution
news.para: ORERA has issued guidelines for its conciliation and dispute resolution (CDR) cell, aiming to facilitate amicable resolutions between homebuyers, promoters, and agents. The CDR cell will handle disputes referred by ORERA or through direct application, with a nominal fee for conciliation.

news.title: Redevelopment, reform sops at core of ₹1 lakh-crore new urban fund
news.para: The Indian govt is launching a ₹1 lakh crore Urban Challenge Fund to transform cities by redeveloping abandoned buildings and repurposing government land with private sector involvement. Around 300 cities will compete for funding, with the Centre contributing 25% of project costs, emphasizing drainage, sanitation, and incentivizing municipal reforms for urban growth.

news.title: Goa cabinet allows NBCC to sell 1.5 lakh sq meter of government-owned redeveloped areas
news.para: The Goa government has approved a deal with NBCC (India) Ltd for the construction and redevelopment of seven projects, including Junta House and KTC bus stand, on a PPP basis. NBCC will be permitted to sell over 1.5 lakh sqm of built-up areas, predominantly in Panaji, to fund the Rs 1,700 crore project.

news.title: Greater Noida: Amrapali Golf Homes Society fined for poor waste management
news.para: Greater Noida Authority penalized Amrapali Golf Homes Society with a Rs 25,000 fine due to inadequate waste management practices. An inspection revealed scattered garbage, prompting a warning to the AOA and maintenance staff to adhere to Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. The rules mandate bulk waste generators to segregate and manage waste at the source, prohibiting littering and burning.

news.title: Arnya, Supreme Universal set up ₹1,000 crore platform for Mumbai, Pune redevelopment projects
news.para: Arnya Real Estate Fund and Supreme Universal have established a Rs 1,000 crore real estate equity fund to target residential redevelopment projects in Mumbai and Pune. The fund, with a base corpus of Rs 500 crore and a green-shoe option of an additional Rs 500 crore, will focus on non-slum redevelopment, particularly society and MHADA projects.

news.title: Bihar RERA orders refund of invested amount to 18 homebuyers of PK Villa Project
news.para: RERA Bihar has ordered Agrani Homes to refund ₹1 crore to 18 homebuyers of the PK Villa Project, proportionally based on their investments. The authority is also planning to auction seized lands from Agrani Homes and other builders to further compensate affected homebuyers.

news.title: Haryana RERA orders Ansal Housing & Samyak Projects to compensate buyer
news.para: HRera has directed Ansal Housing and Samyak Projects to compensate a homebuyer for delays in their Ansal Hub 83 Boulevard project. The realtors must pay 10.9% interest on the paid amount from the due possession date. HRera nullified the cancellation of the unit and ordered the builders to allot an alternate unit to the complainant.

news.title: Karnataka HC strikes down real estate regulatory authority’s retro delay fee
news.para: The Karnataka High Court has quashed a circular issued by the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (Rera) that sought to retrospectively impose a 'delay fee' for the late submission of quarterly updates and annual audit statements. The court cited the absence of legislative sanction for the fee, emphasizing that such charges must be authorized by law, not merely by executive order.

news.title: Trial run held for Metro Lines 4 and 4A in Thane; project to cut travel time significantly
news.para: A trial run for Metro Lines 4 and 4A's first phase was successfully conducted in Thane, with officials projecting a significant reduction in travel time across the Mumbai Metropolitan Region. Chief Minister Fadnavis highlighted the project's potential to benefit 22 lakh daily commuters, saving them 50-75% of travel time.

news.title: Borrowers can't redeem property after publication of auction notice under SARFAESI: SC
news.para: The Supreme Court has ruled that borrowers cannot reclaim property after an auction notice is published, as purchasers gain definitive rights once a sale certificate is issued under the SARFAESI Act. The court highlighted ambiguities in the Act and urged the Finance Ministry to address them.
